block.p: Erin Gilbert and Owen Peck Grover were married last evening by Rabbi Chava Koster at Wave Hill in Riverdale, the Bronx.

Ms. Gilbert, 27, is keeping her name. She graduated magna cum laude from Barnard College and is studying medicine at the SUNY Health Sciences Center at Brooklyn. She is the daughter of Rondi Gilbert of Berkeley, Calif., and Anthony Milosz of Montclair, Calif. Her father is a computer systems designer in Montclair. Her mother is an instructor in writing and educational technology at the University of California at Berkeley. Her grandfather, Czeslaw Milosz, won the 1980 Nobel Prize for Literature.
Erin Gilbert and Owen Peck Grover were married last evening by Rabbi Chava Koster at Wave Hill in Riverdale, the Bronx.

Ms. Gilbert, 27, is keeping her name. She graduated magna cum laude from Barnard College and is studying medicine at the SUNY Health Sciences Center at Brooklyn. She is the daughter of Rondi Gilbert of Berkeley, Calif., and Anthony Milosz of Montclair, Calif. Her father is a computer systems designer in Montclair. Her mother is an instructor in writing and educational technology at the University of California at Berkeley. Her grandfather, Czeslaw Milosz, won the 1980 Nobel Prize for Literature.

Mr. Grover, 26, is a project manager for Bluetip, a Manhattan company, which develops computer software. He is a son of Andrea and Warren Grover of West Orange, N.J. His mother is an adjunct associate professor of humanities at New York University. His father retired as the president of MDM Technologies, a direct mail company in Elizabeth, N.J.
